content.description:
Stout overhanging face a tiny ways left of Star Walls crack.  Some funky sidepulls give way to sustained edging and a long move to a horizontal rail.

Pump out right on the rail to Star Wall Crack anchors...or continue for the 13d extention "Steep Climb Named Desire"...
content.protection: Usually fixed down to the first draw or two...
content.location:
Start off a boulder a few feet left of Star Walls crack.

There's a no-hands KB at the 3rd bolt.  You may want to exploit it...

content.description: Good holds and fun movement for the first 2/3rd of the climb leads to a stance before transitioning on to the head wall. Thin and technical climbing past 2 more bolts leads to the anchor
content.location: just to the right of On the Outskirts of Hope

content.description: Done in about 2006 or 2007 then a hold got snapped off the wall.
content.location: Start on warp factor but go straight up for two more bolts to an anchor, the original route Scott Frye bolted on the wall.

content.description: Another incredible line featuring powerful moves on slopers and side pulls to an insane crux right hand throw into a miserable flaring hand jam in a diagonal seam. Power up the downward pointing flake into the kneebar pod and finish pulling the roof above with another boulder problem on awkward jams.
content.protection: Approximately 9 bolts and 2 for the anchors. You may find it with fixed draws in the summer and fall.
content.location: Next route right of Bronco, 3rd route from the left.

content.description: The sick finger/hands crack splitting the right side of Star Walls.  Boulder the start (entering from left is better for tall guys) and pump up to the savage l.b. move just before the anchors.
content.protection: Singles .3-1 BD, single .2/.3 offset or tcu.
content.location: Obvious chalked crack on Star Walls===--lower off anchors.

content.description:
One of the less-trafficked variations on the

Bronco

line. Instead of clipping the fourth bolt on the right face of the dihedral, clip the chain draw out left. Continue up the dihedral as for the other lines, but instead of continuing up and right, bust out left after gaining the finger ledge at the top of the dihedral. Clip the 5th bolt from the good holds and gear up for some crack bouldering wizardry.

The business on this one is quite brief, but if the words "crack bouldering" appeal to you, give it a shot. The route also has the benefit of not interfering with any of the popular neighboring lines and can be a good one to attempt on busier days at the crag.
content.location:
Shares a start with

Bucko/Bronco

under the obvious dihedral, and takes the straightest and leftmost bolt line of the variants.

content.description: Climb a juggy flake until it peters out, then move slightly right on to the face past edges and underclings.
content.location: Lone route on a small block, on the far left side of South Star Wall.

content.description: Pinch and slap your way up the arete, with a couple of thank-god face holds thrown in. The crux comes just before the 4th bolt moving to a positive right-hand edge. The finish eases up but isn't a gimme.
content.location: On the far far right side of South Star Wall. Traverse right along the base of the wall up and past Ali, passing through a tunnel, then scramble up onto a large, flat ledge. Double back left along the base via a small ledge system, Over The Line is the obvious arete left of an orange-tinted face.

content.description: Start on a flake on the right side of the wall with fun opening arete moves then mostly cruising the face on the right side of the arete. At half heighth, follow the slab back leftwards under a small roof and work out the tenous crux up and left around the arete, then back to the right side on small crimps and delicate feet. The last third involves 5.11 face climbing on the right side of the arete with a pump that builds to the end.
content.protection: 10 fixed draws with mussy hooks at the top.
content.location: The arete on the right side of the wall and right of Star Wars Crack.

content.description: Climb easy terrain to a flaring crack system through powerful lie-backing and a few bouldery sequences. An exciting finish awaits.
content.location: Far right of Star Wall just as the wall starts to bend around the corner. This climb follows the line where the rock turns from white to black.

content.description: Start and finish as for Cookie Mix but right before the upper shallow dihedral traverse right along the diagonal break to a tricky boulder sequence and tackle the engaging face and flaring vertical seam thru 2 fixed chains before rejoining the finish on Cookie Mix.
content.protection: Same as for Cookie mix except for the 2 fixed chains for the variation.
content.location: Start and finish as for Cookie Mix

content.description: Short but sustained on clean, well-featured granite.  Follow a rail feature, to a big undercling, to a series of slopey sidepulls and gastons.
content.location: On the far far right side of South Star Wall. Traverse right along the base of the wall up and past Ali, passing through a tunnel, then scramble up onto a large, flat ledge. Double back left along the base via a small ledge system, Juggernaut is basically where the ledge ends.

content.description:
Essentially a link up of Star Walls Crack to Steep Climb...maybe a bit harder due to the stopper crux of the Crack coming just before the bouldering on Steep Climb.

Also no fluff (rest) like on the horizontal on Warp Factor.
content.protection: Rack for Star Walls, Steep Climb is likely fixed...
content.location: Start up the obvious crack but don't lower at the rail...just keep pumping...

content.description: Short, techy route following an arête to a small roof. Hard to tell if you should straddle the arête, or slap your left hand up it - straddle it. Crux comes making a small bump to a good hold near the 3rd bolt. The route continues right to the anchors of Ali.
content.location: Far right side of South Star Wall, following an obvious arête to small roof.

content.description: This is an incredibly fun climb. Start on cool slopey edges and jugs down low. Move into a neat crux then up and around a roof to a sweet slab move. Find the jugs and work into the beautiful golden dihedral. Exit onto steep blocky jugs and use good footwork to pull the final roof out to a small headwall and finally the anchors. Superb movement calling for a variety of techniques in a stunningly aesthetic location. Have fun!
content.location: Far left side of Star Wall.

content.description:
Start up a splitter crack, then mantle onto a sloping ledge. Step a bit left and make a move off the ledge to clip a bolt (don't miss the small cam in a horizontal seam below to protect this). Campus out right along a juggy rail past another bolt, with the crux at the very end, making a funky mantle/rockover to reach the anchors.

There is another set of bolts that heads right along the arete where the crack ends. It's called a 5.12+ project in the Horniak guide, but might be more like 5.13+. You can try it on the way down, good luck.
content.location: Far right side of South Star Wall, about 50' right of Ali (the last line with fixed draws).

content.description: A easier variation finish to Bronco. Start on Bronco. Climb through the stem dihedral and finish straight up through jam cracks once the knee bar pod is gained. Great steep crack-style climbing.

To the right of

Cookie Mix

is the start for a number of route variations, the best of which is Bronco, an incredibly thuggish but stellar 12d. Work into the awkward, slightly overhanging left-facing dihedral and follow along the right-trending series of overlapping roofs until you encounter a large downward pointing flake. Muscle up and to the right of this and finagle a knee bar rest in an obvious pod before tackling the dramatic undercling traverse beneath the huge roof. Pull up and right in the break as you join the headwall finish for

A Steep Climb Named Desire

.
content.protection: Approximately 10 fixed draws to mussies. It can be helpful to back-clean a couple along the way to reduce the rope drag on the headwall.
content.location: right of Cookie Mix, 2nd route from the left.

content.description: Climb a few feet up to a small ledge then continue through sequential crimps. Trend left, up a good rail, to jugs then a very short face up to the chains.
content.location: Just around the right corner from the main part of Star Wall. This climbs the right bolt line of the pair located just to the right of a fin-like protrusion and narrow roof.

content.description: Essentially an extension to Warp Factor that tops out Star Walls. Bring some guns to fire through the ticky tack "bearhug" flake.
content.protection: Mostly fixed, might need a draw or two for the start.
content.location: After sending Warp Factor, brace yourself for some hard pumpy bouldering...the roof has amazing buckets but there is still a typical Donner 5.11 technical move guarding the anchor.
